casebody.data:
Otis O. EDWARDS, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. The ATLANTIC GROUP, INCORPORATED, Defendant—Appellee. No. 08-1763. United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Submitted: Nov. 13, 2008. Decided: Nov. 18, 2008. Otis O. Edwards, Appellant Pro Se. Douglas Robinson Burtch, Littler Mendel-son, PC, McLean, Virginia; Kimberly Jeanne Gost, Littler Mendelson PC, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, for Appellee.

Before WILKINSON, NIEMEYER, and SHEDD, Circuit Judges.

*213Affirmed by unpublished PER CURIAM opinion.

Unpublished opinions are not binding precedent in this circuit.

PER CURIAM:

Otis 0. Edwards appeals the district court’s order dismissing his employment discrimination action. We have reviewed the record and find no reversible error. Accordingly, we affirm for the reasons stated by the district court. Edwards v. The Atlantic Group, Inc., No. 2:07-cv-00433-RAJ-TEM (E.D. Va. June 23, 2008). We dispense with oral argument because the facts and legal contentions are adequately presented in the materials before the court and argument would not aid the decisional process.

AFFIRMED.
